data.title: Meme. Review.
data.statement:
Your program must become the new PewDiePie and calculate meme review scores for any inputted meme!
A meme review score is calculated by taking the sum of the ASCII values of all the unique alphanumeric characters in the meme name, modulus by the length of the meme name string. And of course it must be out of 10, so the value can never be less than 0 or greater than 10. Thus, if the meme review score is greater than 10, it must be shown as 10. And due to the nature of positive integers and modulus, the meme review score will never be less than 0.

Example: 'nyan cat'
unique alphanumeric chars = n, y, a, c, t
sum of unique letters ASCII value = 110+121+97+99+116 = 543
length of meme input string = 8
543 mod 8 = 7
output = "7/10"
data.outputDescription: <<Line 1:>> The meme review score of [[meme]]. Cannot be less than 0/10, and cannot be greater than 10/10.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Your program must become the new PewDiePie and calculate meme review scores for any inputted meme!
A meme review score is calculated by taking the sum of the ASCII values of all the unique alphanumeric characters in the meme name, modulus by the length of the meme name string. And of course it must be out of 10, so the value can never be less than 0 or greater than 10. Thus, if the meme review score is greater than 10, it must be shown as 10. And due to the nature of positive integers and modulus, the meme review score will never be less than 0.

Example: 'nyan cat'
unique alphanumeric chars = n, y, a, c, t
sum of unique letters ASCII value = 110+121+97+99+116 = 543
length of meme input string = 8
543 mod 8 = 7
output = "7/10"
Input
Line 1: A single string, meme.
Output
Line 1: The meme review score of meme. Cannot be less than 0/10, and cannot be greater than 10/10.
Constraints
0 <= length of meme <= 100
Example
Input
nyan cat
Output
7/10
